numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This graph compares the percentages of adults who are 15-24 years old with the percentages of adults who are 40+ years old.
2. The graph shows the viewpoints of these adults about whether the world is getting better.
4. There are two generations in the graph.
5. These two generations have two different perspectives on the world.
6. In almost every country, the 15-24-year-old adults think that the world is getting better more than the 40+-year-old adults think that the world is getting better.
7. Indonesia is an outlier in the graph.
8. I wonder which factors cause Indonesia to be an outlier.
9. I wonder whether environmental factors cause both age groups in Indonesia to think that the world is getting better.
10. I wonder whether lifestyle choices cause both age groups in Indonesia to think that the world is getting better.
11. I wonder whether life-changing events occurred in Indonesia.
12. I wonder whether these life-changing events caused Indonesia to be an outlier.
14. Everything in our world advances daily.
15. People come up with new things daily.
16. People come up with new ways to make our world better.
17. I wonder whether these new ways of life actually make our world better.
18. I wonder whether the younger generations only assume that the world is better than it was.
